intro: Dipteracanthus patulus var. obtusior, commonly known as the broad-leaved dipteracanthus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Dipterocarpaceae, which includes many tropical trees and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows in lowland rainforests and thrives in humid, warm climates. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological significance in its native habitat.
